channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In first interview, Pope Leo XIV takes on billionaires, polarization and war
item.description: Pope Leo XIV reflected on the legacy of Pope Francis and whether he sees himself as more U.S. American or Peruvian.

item.title: Starvation and Bombs in Besieged Sudanese City As Residents Cry for Help
item.description: At least 260,000 civilians trapped in El Fasher face a dire choice: risk being starved or bombed if they stay, and raped or killed if they flee.

item.title: Rubio, in Israel, Says a Diplomatic Solution to Gaza War May Not be Possible
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel to discuss President Trump’s desire to see the war in Gaza end soo...

item.title: A Utah church embarks on a healing journey in the aftermath of the Kirk assassination
item.description: A church in Orem, Utah, the city where Charlie Kirk was killed, brings healing during its Sunday service. "We're going to be navigating this as a comm...

item.title: What we know about the suspect arrested in Charlie Kirk's killing. And, Emmy takeaways
item.description: Authorities say the suspect in the Charlie Kirk murder investigation is not cooperating. However, the people around him are. Here's what we know. And,...

item.title: Democrats will 'either adapt or die' as strategists push them onto new platforms
item.description: Prominent Democratic lawmakers and influencers are encouraging their fellow Democrats to embrace social media and online video to reach voters or risk...

item.title: Trump Redirects Millions to Historically Black Colleges, Charter Schools
item.description: The Trump administration is cutting money from programs that have supported minority students, including at other universities.

item.title: To save its rare birds, New Zealand is relying on a nation of backyard trappers
item.description: New Zealand's unique birds are at risk of extinction, like the kiwi. So the country is trying to eradicate the invasive species that prey on them. Eve...

item.title: Elon Musk Buys $1 Billion in Tesla Stock as Board Defends His Pay
item.description: Tesla’s chief executive bought the stock after the company’s board proposed paying him nearly $1 trillion if he achieves certain performance goals.

item.title: Bobby Hart, Who Helped Give the Monkees Their Music, Dies at 86
item.description: The hit songwriting duo he and Tommy Boyce formed in the 1960s was best known for the unexpectedly popular tunes of a made-for-TV band.

item.title: India-Pakistan Tensions Hit New Pitch With Cricket Snub

item.title: Starvation and Bombs in Besieged Sudanese City As Residents Cry for Help
item.description: At least 260,000 civilians trapped in El Fasher face a dire choice: risk being starved or bombed if they stay, and raped or killed if they flee.

item.title: U.S., China Conclude Talks With ‘Framework’ on TikTok Sale
